thread.title: Bosnia Herzegovina national carrier faces collapse
thread.title_full: Bosnia Herzegovina national carrier faces collapse | Finance & Data content from ATWOnline

author: Alan Dron
title: Bosnia Herzegovina national carrier faces collapse
text:
Bosnia & Herzegovina Airlines has until the beginning of August to deliver a plan to pull itself out of a financial chasm or face permanent closure.
The move follows a decision by the Balkan nation’s Ministry of Communications & Transport’s Directorate of Civil Aviation, to suspend the carrier’s air operator’s certificate (AOC) earlier this month.
The 90-day suspension was imposed because of the airline’s non-compliance with regulations due to its financial difficulties, Directorate of Civil Aviation spokesman Aleksandar Lalović said.
Those difficulties had led BH Airlines to cease operations prior to suspension of its AOC, he said. The carrier operated two ATR 72-200 turboprops, although local media reports have said that one has been grounded in Germany for some time due to the airline’s financial problems.
Local media have reported debts of BAM23 million ($12.9 million), owed mainly to the carrier’s aircraft lessor. Lalović said the regulator was not familiar with the exact nature of the airline’s debts.
ATW’s calls to the airline’s offices went unanswered.
BH Airlines now has “to deliver analyses of the company’s situation in all segments, including [its] financial situation and a plan of compliance with BH regulations,” he said.
Failure to deliver a satisfactory report “may cause the final suspension [of the AOC] according to national regulations.”
